{{Infobox Military Conflict |conflict=1997 Vavunathivu Offensive |partof=the [[Sri Lankan civil war]] |image= |caption= |date=March 7, 1997 |place=[[Sri Lanka]] |casus= |territory= |result= [[LTTE]] victory |combatant1=[[Image:Coat of arms of Sri Lanka.svg|18px]] [[Military of Sri Lanka]] |combatant2=[[Liberation Tigers of Tamil Eelam]] |commander1= Unknown |commander2=Unknown |strength1=Unknown |strength2=Unknown |casualties1=75 killed & 70 wounded (SLA claim) <ref name="sundaytimes.lk">{{cite news |first= |last= |title=Tiger triple jump in the Eastern theatre|url=http://sundaytimes.lk/970309/sitrep.html|work=SundayTimesLanka|date=1997-03-09|accessdate=2009-01-03}}</ref> |casualties2=103 killed (Tamil Tiger claim) <ref name="tamilnet.com">{{cite news |first= |last= |title=Fighters killed in Vavunathivu SLA camp attack remembered|url=http://www.tamilnet.com/art.html?catid=13&artid=8485|work=TamilNet|date=2003-03-07|accessdate=2009-01-03}}</ref> |notes= }} The '''1997 Vavunathivu Offensive'''<ref name="sundaytimes.lk" /> was a military operation in which the [[Tamil Tigers]] captured [[Vavunathivu]] [[Army]] camp from the [[Sri Lanka Army|Sri Lankan Army]]. The [[Tamil Tigers]] are believed to have captured large amounts of weapons & ammunitions<ref name="tamilnet.com" /> in this operation.
